alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 4:08PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST/815 PM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR AREAS BETWEEN WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENT AND GRAY MOUNTAIN... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona, including the following county, Coconino. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MST /815 PM MDT/. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 403 PM MST /503 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Tohachi Wash, Jackrabbit Wash, Deadman Wash, Cedar Wash, Citadel Wash, Haada Is Taani Di Wash, Kish Zhini Wash, Badger Wash, Kanaa Wash, Mays Wash, Tse To Baah Naali Wash, Little Mexican Spring Wash, Doney Mountain Wash, Little Colorado River, White Water Wash, Campbell Francis Wash and Ball Court Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wupatki National Monument, Nalahiku Pueblo, Doney Mountain, Wukoki Pueblo, Gray Mountain, and Black Falls. - This includes U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 440 and 459. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
